DataElement.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Diseases and Disorders Biopsy Confirmation Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not chronic graft versus host disease was confirmed by biopsy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Diseases and Disorders Biopsy Confirmation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the confirmation by removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis for chronic graft versus host disease, a syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases with an onset usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Diseases and Disorders
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases.  Onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.:Confirmed; having been established or verified.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Unk ND NA Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes, no, unknown, not done or not applicable.
